sanskrit: ईशावास्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्च जगत्यां जगत्। तेन त्यक्तेन भुञ्जीथा मा गृधः कस्यस्विद्धनम्॥
transliteration: Isha vasyam idam sarvam yat kincha jagatyam jagat, tena tyaktena bhunjitha ma gridhah kasyasvid dhanam.

translations.swami_vivekananda: All this is pervaded by the Lord, whatever exists in this changing universe. Enjoy what is given by renouncing it. Do not covet, for whose is wealth?
translations.eknath_easwaran: The Lord is enshrined in the hearts of all. The wise, seeing Him everywhere, renounce the selfish pursuit of wealth and embrace simplicity.
translations.sri_aurobindo: All this universe must be pervaded by the Lord, whatsoever is individual universe of movement in the universal motion. By that renounced, thou shouldst enjoy; covet not the wealth of any.
translations.radha_krishnan: Whatever exists in this world is enveloped by the Supreme. One should enjoy life with the spirit of renunciation, not craving another’s wealth.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: यह समस्त जगत ईश्वर से व्याप्त है। त्यागपूर्वक उसका भोग करो और किसी के धन की इच्छा मत करो।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: यह संपूर्ण विश्व ईश्वर से आच्छादित है। त्यागपूर्वक जीवन यापन करो और किसी अन्य के धन की लालसा मत करो।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: This verse emphasizes **non-attachment and renunciation**. The world is pervaded by Brahman, but we must live with detachment, taking only what is necessary.
commentary.madhvacharya: The Supreme Lord Vishnu is the controller of all. One must engage in **devotional service (bhakti)** and avoid material greed.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: This teaches **integral living**—not escapism, but living in the world with a sense of divine purpose.
commentary.swami_chinmayananda: True enjoyment comes from detachment, not possession. Wealth is temporary, but self-realization is eternal.

sanskrit: कुर्वन्नेवेह कर्माणि जिजीविषेच्छतं समाः। एवं त्वयि नान्यथेतोऽस्ति न कर्म लिप्यते नरे॥
transliteration: Kurvanneveha karmani jijivishet satam samah, evam tvayi nanyatheto asti na karma lipyate nare.

translations.swami_vivekananda: By performing one's duties, one should wish to live for a hundred years. Thus, karma does not bind one.
translations.eknath_easwaran: Through selfless action, one can live meaningfully and not be tainted by karma.
translations.sri_aurobindo: Action done in the spirit of surrender to the Divine does not bind the soul.
translations.radha_krishnan: A person should live performing actions without selfish motives; this frees them from karmic bondage.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: मनुष्य को अपने कर्तव्य कर्मों का पालन करते हुए सौ वर्ष तक जीने की इच्छा करनी चाहिए। इससे कर्म बंधन नहीं होता।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: कर्तव्य पालन करते हुए सौ वर्षों तक जीने की इच्छा करनी चाहिए, तभी मनुष्य कर्म से बंधता नहीं।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: This verse teaches **Karma Yoga**—acting without attachment leads to liberation.
commentary.madhvacharya: Selfless duty dedicated to Vishnu purifies the soul and removes karmic bondage.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: Life is to be lived **actively but with surrender** to the higher purpose.
commentary.swami_sivananda: Performing righteous action without selfish desire leads to purity and peace.

sanskrit: असुर्या नाम ते लोका अन्धेन तमसाऽऽवृताः। ताँस्ते प्रेत्याभिगच्छन्ति ये के चात्महनो जनाः॥
transliteration: Asurya nama te loka andhena tamasavritah, tams te pretyabhigachchhanti ye ke chatmahano janah.

translations.swami_vivekananda: Those who kill the Self go to worlds covered in blinding darkness after death.
translations.eknath_easwaran: There are worlds shrouded in darkness, to which those who deny the Self go after leaving this body.
translations.sri_aurobindo: The sunless worlds covered in darkness are the fate of those who slay the Self.
translations.radha_krishnan: The demonic worlds, filled with darkness, are entered by those who destroy their own soul.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: जो आत्मा का नाश करते हैं, वे अंधकार से ढके असुर लोकों में जाते हैं।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: जो आत्मा को मारते हैं, वे अंधकारमय असुर लोकों में जाते हैं।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: This verse warns against spiritual ignorance. Those who neglect the realization of the Self are trapped in delusion and suffering.
commentary.madhvacharya: The verse refers to those who turn away from devotion and righteousness, leading to suffering in lower realms.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: Self-realization is the purpose of human life; ignoring it leads to bondage in ignorance.
commentary.swami_sivananda: A life lived without spiritual pursuit leads to deep suffering in ignorance.

sanskrit: अनेजदेकं मनसो जवीयो नैनद् देवा आप्नुवन्पूर्वमर्षत्। तद्धावतोऽन्यानत्येति तिष्ठत् तस्मिन्नपो मातरिश्वा दधाति॥
transliteration: Anejad ekam manaso javiyo nainad deva apnuvan purvam arshat, tadhavato nyanatyeti tishthat tasminn apo matarishva dadhati.

translations.swami_vivekananda: The Self moves not but is swifter than the mind. The gods cannot reach it, for it moves ahead of them.
translations.eknath_easwaran: Unmoving, it is swifter than the mind. The senses cannot overtake it, for it moves ever ahead.
translations.sri_aurobindo: That which is motionless yet moves faster than thought; the senses reach it not, for it is always ahead.
translations.radha_krishnan: It moves not, yet it is swifter than the mind. The gods fail to reach it as it moves ahead of them.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: आत्मा स्थिर है, फिर भी मन से भी तेज गति करता है। देवता इसे पकड़ नहीं सकते।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: यह आत्मा अचल है, परंतु मन से भी तीव्र गति करता है। देवता इसे पकड़ने में असमर्थ हैं।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: The Self is beyond physical movement. It exists beyond time and space, yet pervades everything.
commentary.madhvacharya: God’s presence is beyond comprehension; His speed and ability are beyond all material limits.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: The Divine exists everywhere, untouched by motion or time. It is beyond human perception.
commentary.swami_sivananda: This verse explains the paradox of the Self—both still and ever-moving, beyond grasp.

sanskrit: तदेजति तन्नैजति तद्दूरे तद्वन्तिके। तदन्तरस्य सर्वस्य तदु सर्वस्यास्य बाह्यतः॥
transliteration: Tad ejati tan naijati tad dure tad antike, tad antar asya sarvasya tad u sarvasya asya bahyatah.

translations.swami_vivekananda: It moves, yet it moves not; it is far, yet it is near. It is within all, and it is outside all.
translations.eknath_easwaran: It moves and it moves not. It is far and it is near. It is within all this, and outside all this.
translations.sri_aurobindo: That moves and that moves not; it is far and it is near. It is within all this and it is outside all this.
translations.radha_krishnan: It moves and it moves not; it is far and near. It is within everything and yet outside everything.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: यह चलता भी है और स्थिर भी है। यह दूर भी है और निकट भी। यह सबके भीतर भी है और बाहर भी।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: यह चलता भी है और नहीं भी। यह दूर भी है और पास भी। यह सबके भीतर और बाहर विद्यमान है।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: The Supreme is paradoxical—it is both in motion and still, immanent and transcendent.
commentary.madhvacharya: This refers to the omnipresence of Vishnu, who exists everywhere and beyond time.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: The Divine is both near to the seeker and infinitely beyond human reach.
commentary.swami_sivananda: This verse teaches the **duality of the Self**, which is both within creation and beyond it.

sanskrit: यस्तु सर्वाणि भूतानि आत्मन्येवानुपश्यति। सर्वभूतेषु चात्मानं ततो न विजुगुप्सते॥
transliteration: Yastu sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātmani evānupaśyati, sarvabhūteṣu ca ātmānaṃ tato na vijugupsate.

translations.english: He who sees all beings in his own self, and his own self in all beings, does not feel any revulsion by such realization.

hindi_translation: जो मनुष्य सभी प्राणियों को अपने आत्मा में और अपने आत्मा को सभी प्राणियों में देखता है, वह किसी से घृणा नहीं करता।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: This verse emphasizes the realization of the unity of the Self with all beings. When one sees all beings as the Self, there is no room for hatred or aversion.
commentary.madhvacharya: Recognizing that the Supreme Self resides in all beings leads to the dissolution of ego and fosters universal compassion.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: The perception of oneness with all existence is the foundation of true knowledge and the eradication of sorrow and delusion.
commentary.swami_chinmayananda: Seeing oneself in all beings and all beings in oneself leads to the highest form of love and eradicates all feelings of separateness.

sanskrit: यस्मिन्सर्वाणि भूतानि आत्मैवाभूद्विजानतः। तत्र को मोहः कः शोकः एकत्वमनुपश्यतः॥
transliteration: Yasmin sarvani bhutani atmaiva abhud vijanatah, tatra ko mohah kah shokah ekatvam anupashyatah.

translations.swami_vivekananda: When a person sees all beings in the Self, what sorrow or delusion can there be?
translations.eknath_easwaran: To the one who perceives the Self in all, there is neither sorrow nor confusion.
translations.sri_aurobindo: He who sees the Self in all beings is free from grief and illusion.
translations.radha_krishnan: Seeing all beings in the Self, what delusion can there be? What sorrow?

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: जो आत्मा को सब प्राणियों में देखता है, वह मोह और शोक से मुक्त हो जाता है।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: जो सभी को आत्मा में देखता है, वह शोक और मोह से मुक्त हो जाता है।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: Seeing unity in all beings is the path to enlightenment.
commentary.madhvacharya: Devotion to the Supreme removes illusion and sorrow.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: Realizing the divine presence in all removes suffering.
commentary.swami_sivananda: Understanding oneness leads to liberation from worldly attachments.

sanskrit: स पर्यगाच्छुक्रमकायमव्रणम। अस्नाविरं शुद्धमपापविद्धम्। कविर्मनीषी परिभूः स्वयंभूः। याथातथ्यतोऽर्थान्व्यदधाच्छाश्वतीभ्यः समाभ्यः॥
transliteration: Sa paryagach chhukram akayam avranam, asnaviram shuddham apapaviddham, kavir manishi paribhuh swayambhuh, yathatathyato’rthan vyadadhach chhashwatibhyah samabhyah.

translations.swami_vivekananda: The Self is all-pervading, pure, free from imperfections, and beyond all sin.
translations.eknath_easwaran: It is bright, bodiless, pure, untouched by evil, wise, self-existent, and pervading all.
translations.sri_aurobindo: The One is bright, bodiless, without defect, pure, all-knowing, and eternal.
translations.radha_krishnan: The Self is radiant, incorporeal, untainted, pure, wise, and eternal.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: आत्मा तेजस्वी, शरीर रहित, पवित्र और शुद्ध है।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: यह आत्मा सर्वव्यापी, शुद्ध और शरीर रहित है।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: The Supreme is beyond material limitations and untouched by sin.
commentary.madhvacharya: Vishnu is the eternal and pure Supreme Lord, beyond imperfections.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: This verse describes the eternal and perfect nature of the Divine.
commentary.swami_sivananda: The Self is pure, wise, and beyond human limitations.

sanskrit: अन्धं तमः प्रविशन्ति येऽविद्यामुपासते। ततो भूय इव ते तमो य उ विद्यायां रताः॥
transliteration: Andham tamah pravishanti ye’avidyam upasate, tato bhuya iva te tamo ya u vidyayam ratah.

translations.swami_vivekananda: They who worship ignorance enter into darkness; but they who delight in knowledge enter into greater darkness.
translations.eknath_easwaran: Those who worship ignorance enter into deep darkness. But those who are devoted to knowledge enter into even deeper darkness.
translations.sri_aurobindo: They who follow ignorance enter into darkness, and they who delight in knowledge enter into even greater darkness.
translations.radha_krishnan: Into blinding darkness enter those who worship ignorance; into still greater darkness, as it were, enter those who delight in knowledge alone.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: जो अज्ञान की उपासना करते हैं, वे अंधकार में प्रवेश करते हैं; पर जो केवल ज्ञान में आसक्त रहते हैं, वे और भी गहरे अंधकार में जाते हैं।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: जो अज्ञान की उपासना करते हैं, वे अंधकार में जाते हैं, और जो केवल ज्ञान में आसक्त रहते हैं, वे और भी घने अंधकार में चले जाते हैं।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: This verse warns against both ignorance and pride in knowledge. True wisdom is beyond both extremes.
commentary.madhvacharya: Devotion to the Supreme removes both ignorance and false intellectualism.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: Both blind ignorance and pride in knowledge lead to suffering; true realization transcends both.
commentary.swami_sivananda: One must go beyond mere intellectualism and ignorance to attain real wisdom.

sanskrit: अन्यदेवाहुर्विद्यया अन्यदाहुरविद्यया। इति शुश्रुम धीराणां ये नस्तद्विचचक्षिरे॥
transliteration: Anyad evahur vidyaya anyad ahur avidyaya, iti shushruma dhiranam ye nas tad vichachakshire.

translations.swami_vivekananda: One thing is attained by knowledge, another by ignorance. So we have heard from the wise.
translations.eknath_easwaran: It is said that knowledge leads to one goal, and ignorance to another. So we have heard from the wise.
translations.sri_aurobindo: Knowledge leads to one result, ignorance to another; this we have heard from the sages.
translations.radha_krishnan: One thing is said to be gained through knowledge, another through ignorance. So have we heard from wise men.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: ज्ञान से कुछ और प्राप्त होता है, और अज्ञान से कुछ और। यह हमने ज्ञानी पुरुषों से सुना है।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: ज्ञान से एक फल मिलता है, और अज्ञान से दूसरा। ऐसा हमने ज्ञानी पुरुषों से सुना है।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: True wisdom is distinct from both blind ignorance and dry intellectual knowledge.
commentary.madhvacharya: Knowledge of Vishnu leads to liberation, while ignorance binds the soul.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: Wisdom must be beyond material knowledge and spiritual ignorance.
commentary.swami_sivananda: Both ignorance and knowledge have different results; one must transcend them.

sanskrit: विद्यां चाविद्यां च यस्तद्वेदोभयं सह। अविद्यया मृत्युं तीर्त्वा विद्ययाऽमृतमश्नुते॥
transliteration: Vidyam cha avidyam cha yas tad vedobhaya saha, avidyaya mrityum tirtva vidyaya amritam ashnute.

translations.swami_vivekananda: He who knows both knowledge and ignorance together overcomes death through ignorance and attains immortality through knowledge.
translations.eknath_easwaran: He who knows both knowledge and ignorance together transcends death through ignorance and attains immortality through knowledge.
translations.sri_aurobindo: By ignorance one crosses beyond death, by knowledge one attains immortality.
translations.radha_krishnan: By ignorance one overcomes death, and by knowledge one attains immortality.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: जो ज्ञान और अज्ञान दोनों को जानता है, वह अज्ञान से मृत्यु को पार कर जाता है और ज्ञान से अमरता प्राप्त करता है।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: जो ज्ञान और अज्ञान दोनों को जानता है, वह अज्ञान से मृत्यु को पार करता है और ज्ञान से अमरता प्राप्त करता है।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: A balanced understanding of material and spiritual life leads to true liberation.
commentary.madhvacharya: Only through devotion to the Lord can one transcend death and attain immortality.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: Both material and spiritual knowledge must be integrated for true realization.
commentary.swami_sivananda: Knowledge alone leads to the eternal, but worldly experience also has its role.

sanskrit: अन्धं तमः प्रविशन्ति येऽसम्भूतिमुपासते। ततो भूय इव ते तमो य उ सम्भूत्या रताः॥
transliteration: Andham tamah pravishanti ye asambhutim upasate, tato bhuya iva te tamo ya u sambhutyam ratah.

translations.swami_vivekananda: Those who worship the Unmanifest enter into darkness; those who delight in the manifest enter into even greater darkness.
translations.eknath_easwaran: They who worship the unmanifest enter darkness; those who are devoted to the manifest enter deeper darkness.
translations.sri_aurobindo: They who adore the Unmanifest enter darkness; they who delight in the manifest enter deeper darkness.
translations.radha_krishnan: Into darkness enter those who worship the Unmanifest; into greater darkness enter those who delight in the manifest alone.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: जो अप्रकट की पूजा करते हैं, वे अंधकार में प्रवेश करते हैं; जो प्रकट में ही लगे रहते हैं, वे और गहरे अंधकार में जाते हैं।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: जो अप्रकट की पूजा करते हैं, वे अंधकार में जाते हैं, और जो केवल प्रकट रूप में आसक्त रहते हैं, वे और भी घने अंधकार में जाते हैं।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: Both materialism and pure abstract belief without realization lead to ignorance.
commentary.madhvacharya: Devotion to the Lord is beyond both the manifest and unmanifest aspects.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: True wisdom goes beyond the seen and unseen realities.
commentary.swami_sivananda: One must go beyond both material and unmanifest worship for true realization.

sanskrit: अन्यदेवाहुः सम्भवादन्यदाहुरसम्भवात्। इति शुश्रुम धीराणां ये नस्तद्विचचक्षिरे॥
transliteration: Anyad evahuh sambhavad anyad ahur asambhavat, iti shushruma dhiranam ye nas tad vichachakshire.

translations.swami_vivekananda: One thing is obtained from the manifest, another from the unmanifest. So we have heard from the wise.
translations.eknath_easwaran: Some say that the fruit of worshiping the manifest is one thing, and of the unmanifest another. So have we heard from the wise.
translations.sri_aurobindo: One result comes from the worship of the manifest, another from the unmanifest. This we have heard from the sages.
translations.radha_krishnan: One result is attained by worshiping the manifest, another by worshiping the unmanifest. So have we heard from wise men.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: प्रकट की उपासना से कुछ और फल प्राप्त होता है, अप्रकट की उपासना से कुछ और। यह हमने ज्ञानी पुरुषों से सुना है।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: प्रकट और अप्रकट की पूजा से भिन्न-भिन्न फल प्राप्त होते हैं, यह हमने ज्ञानी पुरुषों से सुना है।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: Both material devotion and abstract meditation give different results, but realization of the Supreme is beyond both.
commentary.madhvacharya: Bhakti (devotion) to the personal form of God leads to liberation, while impersonal meditation leads to temporary results.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: One must go beyond both the manifest and unmanifest to realize the Supreme.
commentary.swami_sivananda: A balanced understanding of both aspects of the Divine is necessary for liberation.

sanskrit: संभूतिं च विनाशं च यस्तद्वेदोभयं सह। विनाशेन मृत्युं तीर्त्वा सम्भूत्यामृतमश्नुते॥
transliteration: Sambhutim cha vinasham cha yas tad veda ubhayam saha, vinashena mrityum tirtva sambhutyamritam ashnute.

translations.swami_vivekananda: He who understands both the eternal and the transient crosses death through the transient and attains immortality through the eternal.
translations.eknath_easwaran: He who understands both the manifest and the unmanifest transcends death and attains immortality.
translations.sri_aurobindo: By knowledge of the transient, one transcends death; by knowledge of the eternal, one attains immortality.
translations.radha_krishnan: By knowledge of the perishable, one crosses beyond death; by knowledge of the imperishable, one attains immortality.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: जो नश्वर और शाश्वत दोनों को जानता है, वह नश्वर से मृत्यु को पार कर जाता है और शाश्वत से अमरता प्राप्त करता है।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: जो नाशवान और अविनाशी दोनों को जानता है, वह मृत्यु को पार करता है और अमरता प्राप्त करता है।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: True wisdom lies in knowing both the material and spiritual aspects of existence.
commentary.madhvacharya: Knowledge of the material world alone leads to rebirth; knowledge of the Supreme grants liberation.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: Understanding both existence and non-existence leads to self-realization.
commentary.swami_sivananda: Balancing worldly and spiritual wisdom leads to liberation.

sanskrit: हिरण्मयेन पात्रेण सत्यस्यापिहितं मुखम्। तत्त्वं पूषन्नपावृणु सत्यधर्माय दृष्टये॥
transliteration: Hiranmayena patrena satyasyapihitam mukham, tattvam pushann apavrunu satyadharmaya drishtaye.

translations.swami_vivekananda: The face of Truth is covered with a golden veil. O Sun, remove it, so that I may see the truth.
translations.eknath_easwaran: The face of truth is hidden by a golden vessel. O Sun, remove it so that I may see the truth.
translations.sri_aurobindo: The face of truth is covered by a golden lid; remove it, O Sun, so I may see the reality.
translations.radha_krishnan: The face of Truth is hidden by a golden disc. O Sun, remove it that I may behold the truth.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: सत्य का मुख स्वर्णमयी आड़ से ढका हुआ है। हे सूर्य, उसे हटा दो ताकि मैं सत्य को देख सकूँ।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: सत्य का मुख स्वर्णमयी आड़ से ढका है। हे सूर्य, उसे हटा दो ताकि मैं सत्य को देख सकूँ।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: The golden disc represents Maya (illusion), which must be removed to see the ultimate reality.
commentary.madhvacharya: Only through devotion can the veil of illusion be lifted.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: The seeker prays for the removal of illusions to attain true knowledge.
commentary.swami_sivananda: This is a prayer to the Divine for self-realization.

sanskrit: पूषन्नेकर्षे यम सूर्य प्राजापत्य व्यूह रश्मिन् समूह। तेजो यत् रूपं कर्मासि योऽसावसौ पुरुषः सोऽहमस्मि॥
transliteration: Pushann ekarshe yama surya prajapatya vyuha rashmin samuha, tejo yat rupam karman asi yo’sav asau purushah so’ham asmi.

translations.swami_vivekananda: O Sun, the lone traveler, withdraw your rays, so that I may see the Self within you.
translations.eknath_easwaran: O Sun, withdraw your rays, so I may see the true Self beyond.
translations.sri_aurobindo: O Sun, reduce your dazzling light, so that I may see the Supreme Purusha within.
translations.radha_krishnan: O Sun, draw back your rays, so I may behold the Purusha within.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: हे सूर्य, अपनी किरणों को समेटो ताकि मैं उस परम पुरुष को देख सकूँ।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: हे सूर्य, अपनी किरणों को समेटो ताकि मैं परम पुरुष को देख सकूँ।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: The seeker prays to move beyond external light to see the Supreme within.
commentary.madhvacharya: Devotion leads to direct perception of the Supreme Being.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: The sun symbolizes external knowledge, which must be transcended for true realization.
commentary.swami_sivananda: This is a prayer for the final unveiling of truth.

sanskrit: वायुरनिलममृतमथेदं भस्मान्तं शरीरम्। ॐ क्रतो स्मर कृतं स्मर क्रतो स्मर कृतं स्मर॥
transliteration: Vayur anilam amritam athedam bhasmantam shariram, Om krato smara kritam smara krato smara kritam smara.

translations.swami_vivekananda: O Life-breath, merge with the eternal; let this body be reduced to ashes. Om, remember your deeds, remember!
translations.eknath_easwaran: O vital air, merge with the immortal source; let this body be reduced to ashes. Om, remember, remember your deeds!
translations.sri_aurobindo: Let the vital breath merge into the eternal, and the body turn to ashes. Om, meditate on your deeds, meditate!
translations.radha_krishnan: O vital air, merge with the immortal; may this body turn to ashes. Om, meditate on your actions, meditate!

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: हे वायु, अमृत में विलीन हो, यह शरीर भस्म हो जाए। ॐ, अपने कर्मों को स्मरण कर, स्मरण कर।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: हे वायु, अमृत में विलीन हो, यह शरीर भस्म हो जाए। ॐ, अपने कर्मों को स्मरण कर, स्मरण कर।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: This verse signifies the final dissolution of the body and the remembrance of one's deeds at the time of death.
commentary.madhvacharya: Surrendering the body to the divine and remembering Vishnu at death leads to liberation.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: The physical body perishes, but the soul must strive for immortality through divine remembrance.
commentary.swami_sivananda: The dying man must remember God and his past actions, as they determine his future existence.

sanskrit: अग्ने नय सुपथा राये अस्मान् विश्वानि देव वयुनानि विद्वान्। युयोध्यस्मज्जुहुराणमेनो भूयिष्ठां ते नमउक्तिं विधेम॥
transliteration: Agne naya supatha raye asman vishvani deva vayunani vidvan, yuyodhy asmaj juhuranam eno bhuyishtham te namauktim vidhema.

translations.swami_vivekananda: O Fire, lead us on the right path to prosperity. O God, you know all our deeds. Remove from us all sin. We bow to you in devotion.
translations.eknath_easwaran: O Fire, lead us by the right path to the enjoyment of the fruits of our actions. O God, remove all our sins. We offer you our deepest reverence.
translations.sri_aurobindo: O Fire, lead us along the good path to prosperity. O Divine, knowing all deeds, remove our sin and accept our homage.
translations.radha_krishnan: O Fire, lead us by the right path to prosperity. O Divine, knowing all actions, remove our sins. We offer you our homage.

hindi_translation.swami_ramsukhdas: हे अग्नि, हमें शुभ मार्ग पर ले चल। हे देव, हमारे समस्त पापों को दूर कर और हमें समृद्धि प्रदान कर।
hindi_translation.geeta_press: हे अग्नि, हमें शुभ मार्ग पर ले चल। हे देव, हमारे पापों को दूर कर और हमें समृद्धि प्रदान कर।

commentary.adi_shankaracharya: This final verse is a prayer for divine guidance on the righteous path and liberation from sin.
commentary.madhvacharya: By following the path shown by the divine, one attains prosperity and liberation.
commentary.sri_aurobindo: The seeker prays for wisdom, divine guidance, and freedom from ignorance.
commentary.swami_sivananda: A prayer for guidance, purification, and divine grace in the journey of the soul.
